Package game.logic

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
game.logic.Character
game.logic.Enemy
public class Enemy
extends Character
This class inherits the Character class and adds attributes specific to the Enemy. Enemy class mainly consists of each enemy's attack ability which each enemy entity possess. While having all the traits that a classified character has that exists in the game, the enemy carries its own type so it is still considered as a designated character on screen but it distinguishes as an enemy type.

The methods inside this class is immediately used when the player enters the range of the enemy's line of sight. They will match the player's movements and follow them until they get close enough to attack the player. The range is not set in this class.

  • Field Details

    • ENEMY_ID

      public static final int ENEMY_ID
      Creates enemy initial values.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy​(int x, int y, int health, int speed)
      Enemies attributes extended by the character class. Inherit getters and setters for health, speed, X and Y positions for enemy to have.
      Parameters:
      x - enemy's x position
      y - enemy's y position
      health - enemy's health
      speed - enemy's moving speed when chasing player different enemies have different speeds

  • Method Details

    • target

      public void target​(int playerPosX, int playerPosY, int x, int y, int type, int speed)
      Used for enemies to determine which object is a player. Follow and attack player after recognizing that it is a player.
      Parameters:
      playerPosX - give the player's X position
      playerPosY - give the player's Y position
      x - enemy's X position
      y - enemy's Y position
      type - which object enemy is tracking, usually player
      speed - sets the enemy's speed at which they are chasing the player

    • getEnemyDirX

      public int getEnemyDirX()
      Getter method tracks the enemy's X direction it is moving towards.
      Returns:
      the enemy's X speed direction

    • getEnemyDirY

      public int getEnemyDirY()
      Getter method tracks the enemy's Y direction it is moving towards.
      Returns:
      the enemy's Y speed direction

    • getType

      public int getType()
      Getter method used to detect if it is a type enemy.
      Returns:
      enemy's ID
